video.title: Strings: [bracket notation] - Beau teaches JavaScript
video.description:
Bracket notation allows you to access a specific character in a string.

🐦 Beau Carnes on Twitter: https://twitter.com/carnesbeau

topLevelComment.author: Muhammad Yasir
topLevelComment.text:
Important point

- The strings of JS are just like arrays in other languages, difference being immutability in JS.

- The first letter of a string myString is queried by ... myString[0] .

- The last letter by ... myString[myString.length - 1] .

topLevelComment.author: Anna Maria
topLevelComment.text: This helped me understand immutability better.  Thank you!  Great videos.

topLevelComment.author: Cesar Cruz
topLevelComment.text: can someone please post a practical example of how indexing in javascript is used? I am learning along but am having a hard time connecting this and other concepts to how I might use them later on in dev.
